newsitem.title: UK: Greenpeace occupies Conoco office in Atlantic protest.
newsitem.headline: Greenpeace occupies Conoco office in Atlantic protest.

text.p: Activists from environmental group Greenpeace have occupied the London offices of U.S. oil company Conoco to protest against plans to explore for oil in the Atlantic Ocean.
"We have people from Greenpeace in the building, there are various Conoco people speaking to them and listening to their concerns," a spokeswoman for Conoco said.
She said that the protesters entered the building at around 8.00 a.m local time (0700 GMT) this morning.
Greenpeace said that 15 activists with briefcases containing hidden tape recorders gained access to the central London office and chained themselves to various parts of the building.
Conoco is a unit of U.S. chemicals giant Du Pont Co. It retails petrol in Britain under the brand name Jet.
"The activists inside the building are refusing to leave until Jet gives Greenpeace an assurance that it will not explore for new oil in the Atlantic Frontier," Greenpeace said in a statement.
Conoco won the right to explore for oil in the Atlantic Ocean to the west of the Shetland Islands in Britain's seventeenth offshore licensing round.
